The United States Attorney’s Office for the Southern District of New York is sending additional discovery materials related to the case *US v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (MN)) to counsel. This includes a cover letter, a hard drive containing documents, and supplemental productions of testifying and non-testifying witness material and exhibits. The materials will also be available via USAfx. The sender requests confirmation regarding pickup of the hard drive or FedEx delivery options.

A communication regarding the discovery production in the case of *US v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). A corrected cover letter was sent to Laura Mennin, detailing a correction of an SDNY file number error (changing SDNY_GM_02774195 to SDNY_GM_02774105). Ghislaine Maxwell's sentencing victim, Ghislaine Maxwell, submitted a victim impact statement on June 1st, 2022. The statement, along with two photo exhibits ("Suicide_l_-_2008.pdf", "Suicide_l_-_pic_2.pdf"), was emailed by [REDACTED] to EFTA00037007. The email included a statement and photographic evidence related to the sentencing.

Attached documents relate to the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. A “Masseuses” list, initially intended for trial, originated from a digital device seized from Epstein’s residence and contained names of women and girls, some minors, contacted for massages by Epstein, Maxwell, and staff. A black book, seized during the Miami-Palm Beach investigation, included identified minors under “massage” and sections were redacted from trial exhibits. Flight logs provided by Epstein’s pilot were also presented as trial exhibits and had minor victims redacted.

The meeting will cover the location of these exhibits. The meeting ID is 992 590 258 641, and the phone conference ID is 547 396 8#.

On March 24, 2025, at 4:00 PM - 4:30 PM EST, a Microsoft Teams meeting occurred involving the FBI Baltimore/Delaware Violent Crime Safe Streets Task Force and a “[REDACTED]” participant. timeline.summary: Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP submitted redacted exhibits (0-P, S, W-X) related to the U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330) to Judge Nathan and all counsel under seal, as per Court Order Dkt. 89. The exhibits were attached as PDFs and included supporting images.

This document is a redaction analysis related to file EFTA00032790.pdf, generated on December 26, 2025. It details six redactions from an email chain concerning “AJN Order – Pretrial Motions,” including emails between individuals associated with the United States Attorney’s Office, Southern District of New York, and redacted recipients. The emails discuss multiple orders, including MN Order- Pretrial Motions and AJN Order- Pretrial Motions.

A paralegal specialist at the U.S. Attorney’s Office I SDNY is seeking clarification on two questions: whether someone wants to “get out” 3500, and whether someone will send Khalilah a list of all admitted exhibits, including DXs LV-3A, LV-3B, LV-4, LV-5, and J-3 (attached to the email).

Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP submitted documents to Judge Nathan regarding Ghislaine Maxwell’s bail motion in U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (MN)). The submissions included a cover letter, an unredacted renewed bail motion, and unredacted exhibits A-E. These documents were sent under seal due to the volume of materials.

An email was sent from EFTA00023219 to Il and icril regarding a bail application for Maxwell. The email includes a memorandum in support of the application and a full submission with exhibits, including redacted versions of the defense’s filings, shared via a link.

Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP submitted exhibits O-X (unredacted) to Judge Nathan in the case of U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) under seal, as per Court Order Dkt. 89. The exhibits included PDFs and images labeled Exhibit_O.pdf through Exhibit_X.pdf. The email also contained a confidentiality notice and a privacy policy link.

Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP submitted documents to Judge Nathan in the case of *U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (MN)) under seal. The documents included a cover letter, an unredacted reply memorandum, a redacted reply memorandum, and accompanying exhibits A and B. The submission was in response to a renewed bail motion.
The document, identified as EFTA00011254.pdf, contains exhibits B through B, EFTA00011255 through EFTA00011258.

This document, identified as EFTA00016946, consists of three exhibits (EFTA00016946, EFTA00016947, and EFTA00016948) presented for redaction analysis. The analysis was generated on December 24, 2025, at 17:07:50.
